Package com.flag4j.util

Class RandomCNumber

java.lang.Object
com.flag4j.util.RandomCNumber
public class RandomCNumber extends Object
An instance of this class is used to generate a stream of random complex numbers. Wraps Random class.

    Generates a pseudorandom complex number with normally distributed magnitude with a mean of 0.0 and standard deviation of 1.0.

  • Field Details

    • rng

      protected final Random rng
      Random number generator.

  • Constructor Details

    • RandomCNumber

      public RandomCNumber()
      Constructs a complex value random number generator. The seed of this random number generator is very likely to be distinct from any other invocation of this constructor.

    • RandomCNumber

      public RandomCNumber​(long seed)
      Constructs a complex value random number generator. Use this constructor with a seed value for reproducible results.
      Parameters:
      seed - Seed for this random number generator.

  • Method Details

    • random

      public CNumber random()
      Generates a pseudorandom complex number with a magnitude uniformly distributed in [0.0, 1.0).
      Returns:
      A pseudorandom complex number with a magnitude uniformly distributed in [0.0, 1.0).

    • random

      public CNumber random​(double mag)
      Generates a uniformly distributed pseudorandom complex number with given magnitude.
      Parameters:
      mag - Magnitude of the complex number. Must be non-negative.
      Returns:
      random complex number with specified magnitude.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the magnitude is negative.

    • random

      public CNumber random​(double min, double max)
      Generates a pseudorandom complex number with magnitude uniformly distributed in [min, max).
      Parameters:
      min - Minimum value for random number. Must be non-negative.
      max - Maximum value for random number. Must be larger than or equal to min.
      Returns:
      A pseudorandom complex number with magnitude uniformly distributed in [min, max).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If min is not positive or if max is less than min.

    • randn

      public CNumber randn()
      Generates a pseudorandom complex number with normally distributed magnitude with a mean of 0.0 and standard deviation of 1.0.
      Returns:
      A pseudorandom complex number with normally distributed magnitude with a mean of 0.0 and standard deviation of 1.0.

    • randn

      public CNumber randn​(double mean, double std)
      Generates a pseudorandom complex number with normally distributed magnitude with a specified mean and standard deviation.
      Parameters:
      mean - Mean of normal distribution to sample magnitude from.
      std - Standard deviation of normal distribution to sample magnitude from.
      Returns:
      A pseudorandom complex number with normally distributed magnitude with a specified mean and standard deviation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If standard deviation is negative.

    • randomReal

      public CNumber randomReal()
      Generates a pseudorandom complex number with a real component uniformly distributed in [0.0, 1.0) and an imaginary component of zero.
      Returns:
      A pseudorandom complex number with a real component uniformly distributed in [0.0, 1.0) * and an imaginary component of zero.

    • randomReal

      public CNumber randomReal​(double min, double max)
      Generates a pseudorandom complex number with real component uniformly distributed in [min, max) and * an imaginary component of zero.
      Parameters:
      min - Minimum value for real component. Must be non-negative.
      max - Maximum value for real component. Must be larger than or equal to min.
      Returns:
      A pseudorandom complex number with real component uniformly distributed in [min, max) and an imaginary component of zero.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If min is not positive or if max is less than min.

    • randnReal

      public CNumber randnReal()
      Generates a pseudorandom complex number with a normally distributed real component with a mean of 0.0 and standard deviation of 1.0. The imaginary component will be zero.
      Returns:
      A pseudorandom complex number with a normally distributed real component with a mean of 0.0 and standard deviation of 1.0. The imaginary component will be zero.

    • randnReal

      public CNumber randnReal​(double mean, double std)
      Generates a pseudorandom complex number with normally distributed real component with a specified mean and standard deviation and an imaginary component of zero.
      Parameters:
      mean - Mean of normal distribution to sample magnitude from.
      std - Standard deviation of normal distribution to sample magnitude from.
      Returns:
      A pseudorandom complex number with normally distributed real component with a specified mean and standard deviation and an imaginary component of zero.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If standard deviation is negative.
